moves.1. e4:
The One I Didn't Deserve.

Really didn't deserve to win this one, ended up with a bit of a trick and was grateful!
moves.1... e6 2. d4 Qh4 3. Qf3 Nc6 4. Ne2 Nh6: Black already has the tempo, forcing me to respond to him rather than vica versa.
moves.6. c3 d5 7. e5 Qe4 8. Qxe4 dxe4: Pleased to exchange queens. With such an aggressive opponent I figure the less material the better.
moves.9. Ng3 e3 10. fxe3 Rg8 11. Nd2 Be7 12. O: I keep looking at the fork on f6, but I couldn't figure out how to negate the bishop.
moves.15. b4 Nc6 16. Bb5 a6 17. Bxc6+ bxc6: At this point I'm fairly satisfied, two lots of doubles for black and a safish position for me
moves.18. Ref1 Bb7 19. a4 a5 20. Nc5 Bc8 21. N: Trying to be more attacking this move leads to an almost fatal weakness.
moves.21... axb4 22. cxb4 Rxg2: And thats the one I didn't see!
moves.23. Rfg1 Re2: I can't defend e3 and I can see that pawn defense getting rolled up from both sides.
moves.25... Ke7 26. b5: A bad move, I didn't think it through. Trying to protect the pawn from the bishop.
moves.27. Ng8+ Kf8 28. Nf6 bxa4: Now without the rather fortunate positioning I'd be in trouble. If I'd had to take another tempo I think I've had had it from this position.
moves.29. Rg8+ Ke7 30. Re8#: But its a forced move and I sat happily imagining blacks fury after his hard work ;-)
